text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision; and so Abraham begat Isaac and circumcised him the eighth day, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt, but God was with him
speaker: Narrator

text: and delivered him out of all his afflictions and gave him grace and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there came a famine over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great tribulation, and our fathers found no sustenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jacob heard that there was wheat in Egypt, he sent our fathers the first time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the second Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph’s lineage was made known unto Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph sent and called his father Jacob unto him and all his kindred, seventy-five souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jacob went down into Egypt and died, he and our fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: who were carried over into Shechem and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor of Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: until another king arose, who did not know Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same dealt subtly with our kindred and mistreated our fathers so that they exposed their babies to death, to the end that the generation would cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: In which time Moses was born and was beautiful to God and was nourished in his father’s house three months;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when he was put in danger, Pharaoh’s daughter took him in and nourished him as her own son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was taught in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was mighty in his words and deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him and smote the Egyptian, avenging the oppressed;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God was to give them saving health by his hand, but they had not understood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the next day he showed himself unto them as they strove and urged them to peace, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou kill me as thou didst the Egyptian yesterday?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses fled at this word and became a sojourner in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when forty years were expired, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the vision; and as he drew near to consider it, the voice of the Lord came unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob. Then Moses trembled and dared not to behold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet; for the place where thou dost stand is holy ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning and am come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Moses, whom they had refused, saying, Who made thee a prince and a judge? the same did God send as prince and redeemer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought them out, showing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and in the Red Sea and in the wilderness for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is that Moses, who said unto the sons of Israel, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren like unto me; him shall ye hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is he, who was in the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him in the Mount Sinai and with our fathers, who received the oracles of life to give unto us;
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust him from them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying unto Aaron, Make us gods to go before us; for as for this Moses, who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then they made a calf and offered sacrifice unto the idol and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God withdrew and gave them up to worship the host of the heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness?
speaker: Narrator

text: On the contrary, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god Remphan, figures which ye made to worship them; and I will carry you away beyond Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen,
speaker: Narrator

text: which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus {Joshua in Heb.} into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers unto the days of David,
speaker: Narrator

text: who found grace before God and asked to provide a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Solomon built him a house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit the most High does not dwell in temples made with hands, as saith the prophet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven is my throne, and earth is my footstool; what house will ye build me? saith the Lord, or what is the place of my rest?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has not my hand made all these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Spirit; as your fathers did, so do ye.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who of the prophets have your fathers not persecuted? and they have slain those who announced before the coming of the Just One, of whom ye have now been the betrayers and murderers,
speaker: Narrator

text: who have received the law by the disposition of angels and have not kept it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard these things, they were divided in their hearts and gnashed on him with their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up steadfastly into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing on the right hand of God
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, Behold, I see the heavens opened and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And crying out with a loud voice, they stopped their ears and ran upon him with one accord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and casting him out of the city, they stoned him; and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man’s feet, whose name was Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they stoned Stephen calling upon God and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he kneeled down and cried with a loud voice, Lord, impute not this sin to their charge. And having said this, he fell asleep in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} which was at Jerusalem, and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And devout men carried Stephen to his burial and made great lamentation over him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Saul, he made havoc of the congregation; {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} entering into the houses and dragging out men and women, he committed them to prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those that were scattered abroad went everywhere preaching the word of the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria and preached the Christ unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spoke, hearing and seeing the signs which he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, came out of those who were possessed with them, and many paralytics and that were lame were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was great joy in that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there was a certain man called Simon, who before this in the same city used magic arts and amazed the people of Samaria, giving out that he himself was some great one,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This is the great virtue of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to him they had regard because for a long time he had amazed them with magic arts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they believed Philip preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon himself believed also; and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were being done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John unto them,
speaker: Narrator

text: who, when they were come down, prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them; they were baptized only in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Spirit was given, he offered them money,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter, for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness and pray God, if perhaps this thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness and in the prison of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon answered and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, when they had testified and preached the word of God, returned to Jerusalem and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of the Lord spoke unto Philip, saying, Arise and go toward the south unto the way that goes down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he arose and went, and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure and had come to Jerusalem to worship,
speaker: Narrator

text: was returning and sitting in his chariot reading Isaiah the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near and join thyself to this chariot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Philip ran there to him and heard him read the prophet Isaiah and said, Dost thou understand what thou readest?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, How can I, except someone should guide me? And he besought Philip to come up and sit with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter, and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth;
speaker: Narrator

text: in his humiliation his judgment was taken away, and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the eunuch answered Philip and said, I pray thee, of whom does the prophet speak this? of himself or of some other?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Philip opened his mouth and began at the same scripture and preached unto him the gospel of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water; and the eunuch said, See, here is water; what hinders me to be baptized?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Philip said, If thou dost believe with all thine heart, thou may. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still, and they went both down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, so that the eunuch saw him no more, and he went on his way rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Philip was found at Azotus, and passing through, he preached the gospel in all the cities until he came to Caesarea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, came unto the prince of the priests
speaker: Narrator

text: and asked him for letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he proceeded, he came near Damascus; and suddenly there shone round about him a light from heaven;
speaker: Narrator

text: and falling to the earth, he heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why dost thou persecute me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I AM Jesus whom thou dost persecute; it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And the Lord said unto him, Arise and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what it behooves thee to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men who journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing indeed the voice, but seeing no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul arose from the earth; and opening his eyes, he saw no one; so they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus
speaker: Narrator

text: where he was three days without sight, and neither ate nor drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; to whom the Lord said in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I am here, Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto him, Arise and go into the street which is called Straight and enquire in the house of Judas for one called Saul, of Tarsus; for, behold, he prays
speaker: Narrator

text: and has seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him, that he might receive his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, of how much evil he has done to thy saints in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: and even here he has authority from the princes of the priests to bind all that call on thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said unto him, Go; for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles and kings and the sons of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I will show him how much it behooves him to suffer for my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Ananias went and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus who appeared unto thee in the way as thou didst come, has sent me, that thou might receive thy sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales; and he received sight immediately and arose and was baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had received food, he was comforted. Then Saul was certain days with the disciples who were at Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all that heard him were amazed and said, Is not this he that destroyed those who called on this name in Jerusalem and came here for that intent that he might bring them bound unto the princes of the priests?
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul increased the more in strength and confounded the Jews who dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as many days passed, the Jews took counsel among themselves to kill him;
speaker: Narrator

text: but their ambushes were understood by Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples took him by night and let him down by the wall in a basket.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he tried to join himself to the disciples; but they were all afraid of him and did not believe that he was a disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way and that he had spoken to him and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he spoke boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus and disputed against the Greeks; but they went about to slay him,
speaker: Narrator

text: which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him forth to Tarsus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} had rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria and were edified, walking in the fear of the Lord, and with the comfort of the Holy Spirit they were multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all quarters, he came down also to the saints who dwelt at Lydda.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had been in bed eight years, for he was a paralytic.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter said unto him, Aeneas, the Lord Jesus, the Christ, makes thee whole; arise and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him and turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas; this woman was full of good works and alms-deeds {lit. acts of mercy} which she did.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in those days that she was sick and died, whom when they had washed, they laid her in an upper chamber.
speaker: Narrator

text: And since as Lydda was close to Joppa and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, asking him that he not delay to come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping and showing the coats and garments which Dorcas had made them while she was with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter put them all out and knelt down and prayed and turned to the body said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes; and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave her his hand and lifted her up; and calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the company called the Italian,
speaker: Narrator

text: a devout man and one that feared God with all his house, who gave many alms to the people and prayed to God always.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him and saying unto him, Cornelius.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he looked on him, he was afraid and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms {lit. thine acts of mercy} are come up for a memorial before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now send men to Joppa and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter;
speaker: Narrator

text: he lodges with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side; he shall tell thee what it behooves thee to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the angel who spoke unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants and a devout soldier of those that waited on him continually;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when he had declared all these things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the morrow, as they went on their journey and drew near unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he became very hungry and would have eaten; but while they made ready, he fell into a rapture of understanding
speaker: Narrator

text: and saw the heaven opened and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners and let down to the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: in which were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth and wild beasts and reptiles and fowls of the air.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter, kill and eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the voice spoke unto him again the second time, That which God has cleansed, do not call common.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was done three times, and the vessel was received up again into heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men who were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon’s house and stood before the gate
speaker: Narrator

text: and called and asked whether Simon, who was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise therefore and get thee down and go with them, doubting nothing; for I have sent them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter went down to the men who were sent unto him from Cornelius and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek; what is the cause for which ye are come?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man and one that fears God and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by a holy angel to send for thee into his house and to hear words of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called them in and lodged them. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the next day they entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius waited for them and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he talked with him, he went in and found many that were come together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an abominable thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company or come unto one of another nation; but God has showed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I came unto you without doubting, as soon as I was sent for; I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send therefore to Joppa, and call here Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of one Simon a tanner by the sea side, who, when he comes, shall speak unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately therefore I sent to thee, and thou hast done well to come. Now therefore we are all here present before God to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter opened his mouth and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons;
speaker: Narrator

text: but in every nation he that fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word which God sent unto the sons of Israel, preaching the gospel: peace by Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all),
speaker: Narrator

text: that word, I say, ye know, which was published throughout all Judaea and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached,
speaker: Narrator

text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all that were oppressed of the devil, for God was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of Judea and in Jerusalem, whom they slew hanging him on a tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: This same one God raised up the third day and showed him openly,
speaker: Narrator

text: not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, even to us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded us to preach unto the people and to testify that it is he who is ordained of God to be the Judge of living and dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto him all the prophets give witness, that whosoever believes in him shall receive remission of sins through his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter yet spoke these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those of the circumcision who believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, that also on the Gentiles the gift of the Holy Spirit was poured out.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they heard them speak with tongues and magnify God. Then Peter answered,
speaker: Narrator

text: Can anyone forbid water that these should not be baptized, who have received the Holy Spirit as well as we?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus. Then they begged him to tarry certain days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter was come up to Jerusalem, those that were of the circumcision contended with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, Why didst thou go in to men uncircumcised and eat with them?
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter rehearsed the matter from the beginning and expounded it by order unto them, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a rapture of understanding I saw a vision: A certain vessel descended like a great sheet let down from heaven by the four corners, and it came unto me,
speaker: Narrator

text: upon which when I had fastened my eyes, I considered and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth and wild beasts and reptiles and fowls of the air.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter, slay and eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, Not so, Lord, for nothing common or unclean has at any time entered into my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God has cleansed, do not call common.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this was done three times, and it was all drawn up again into heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit bade me go with them, doubting nothing. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he showed us how he had seen an angel in his house, who stood and said unto him, Send to Joppa and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter,
speaker: Narrator

text: who shall tell thee words, by which thou and all thy house shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, as on us at the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I remembered the word of the Lord, when he said, John indeed baptized in water, but ye shall be baptized in the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, if God gave them the same gift as he did unto us, who have believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I should withstand God?
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard these things, they were silent and glorified God, saying, Then God has also granted repentance unto life to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who were scattered abroad by the tribulation that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice and Cyprus and Antioch, preaching the word to no one except only unto the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they came into Antioch, spoke unto the Greeks, preaching the gospel of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} which was in Jerusalem, and they sent forth Barnabas that he should go unto Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who, when he came and had seen the grace of God, was glad and exhorted them all to remain in their purpose of heart in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith, and many people were added unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Barnabas departed to Tarsus to seek Saul, and when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that for a whole year they gathered themselves together with the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} and taught many people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in those days prophets came down from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of them named Agabus stood up and signified by the Spirit that there should be great famine throughout all the world, which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples, each one according to what he had, determined to send relief unto the brethren who dwelt in Judea,
speaker: Narrator

text: which they likewise did and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to mistreat certain of the congregation. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
speaker: Narrator

text: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had apprehended him, he put him in prison and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him, intending after the Passover to bring him forth to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter therefore was kept in the prison, and the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} made prayer without unto God for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and the guards before the door that kept the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon him, and a light shone in the prison, and he smote Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, Arise quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he said unto him, Cast thy garment about thee and follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out and followed him and knew not that it was true which was done by the angel, but thought he saw a vision.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they were past the first and the second guard, they came unto the iron gate that leads unto the city, which opened to them of its own accord, and they went out and passed on through one street, and then the angel departed from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety that the Lord has sent his angel and has delivered me out of the hand of Herod and from all the people of the Jews who waited for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And considering this, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together praying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Peter knocked at the door of the patio, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she recognized Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in and told how Peter stood at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then they said, It is his angel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter continued knocking, and when they had opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to be silent, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go make these things known unto James and to the brethren. And he departed and went to another place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers concerning what was become of Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Herod had sought for him and found him not, he examined the guards and commanded that they should be taken away. Then he went down from Judaea to Caesarea and abode there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Herod was highly displeased with those of Tyre and Sidon, but they came with one accord to him, and, having bribed Blastus, the king’s chamberlain, they asked for peace because their lands were supplied through those of the king’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne and made an oration unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people gave a shout, saying, It is the voice of god, and not of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him because he did not give God the glory, and he expired eaten of worms.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord grew and multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were in the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} that was at Antioch prophets and teachers: Barnabas and Simeon that was called Niger and Lucius of Cyrene and Manaen, who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they ministered to the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work unto which I have called them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they released them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Spirit, departed unto Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they arrived at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews, and they also had John as an attendant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain wise man, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Barjesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man, who called for Barnabas and Saul and desired to hear the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Elymas the wise man (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the proconsul from the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul (who also is Paul), filled with the Holy Spirit, set his eyes on him
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, O full of all deception and all licentiousness, thou son of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is against thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness, and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the proconsul, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Paul and his company sailed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia; then John, departing from them, returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day and sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the princes of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, Ye men and brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said, Men of Israel and ye that fear God hearken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with a high arm he brought them out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the time of about forty years, he suffered their manners in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he divided their land to them by lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward they asked for a king, and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king, to whom also he gave testimony, saying, I have found David, the son of Jesse, a man after my own heart, who shall fulfil all my will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of this man’s seed has God according to his promise raised up Jesus as Saviour unto Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: John, having first proclaimed before his coming, the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am not he. But, behold, there comes one after me, whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Men and brethren, sons of the lineage of Abraham, and whosoever among you fears God, unto you is this word of saving health sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those that dwell at Jerusalem and their princes, because they knew him not nor yet the voices of the prophets who are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled them in condemning him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And without finding cause of death in him, yet they asked Pilate that he should be slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a sepulchre.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised him from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he was seen many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who until now are his witnesses unto the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we declare unto you the gospel of the promise which was made unto the fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: which God has fulfilled unto us their children, in that he has raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he said this, I will give you the sure mercies promised to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he also says in another place, Thou shalt not suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell asleep and was gathered unto his fathers and saw corruption;
speaker: Narrator

text: but he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be it known unto you, therefore, men and brethren, that through this one is preached unto you the remission of sins;
speaker: Narrator

text: and in him all that believe are justified from all the things from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware, therefore, lest what is spoken of in the prophets come upon you:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder and perish, for I do a work in your days, a work which ye would in no wise believe, if one should declare it unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they were gone out of the synagogue of the Jews, the Gentiles besought that these words might be spoken to them the next sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the synagogue was dismissed, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, persuaded them to remain in the grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the next sabbath day almost the whole city came together to hear the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy and spoke against that which Paul said, contradicting and blaspheming.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Paul and Barnabas speaking with freedom, said, It was necessary indeed that the word of God should first have been spoken to you; but seeing ye put it from you and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: For so has the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles that thou should be for saving health unto the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and glorified the word of the Lord, and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women and the principals of the city and raised up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and expelled them out of their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them and came unto Iconium.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in Iconium that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews and so spoke, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the disobedient Jews stirred up the Gentiles and corrupted their desire against the brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: With all this, they abode there a long time speaking with freedom in the Lord, who gave testimony unto the word of his grace and granted that signs and wonders be done by their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the multitude of the city was divided, and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles and also of the Jews with their princes, to insult them and to stone them,
speaker: Narrator

text: they were aware of it and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lies round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there they preached the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain man sat at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked;
speaker: Narrator

text: this man heard Paul speak, who steadfastly beholding him and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
speaker: Narrator

text: said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius because he was the chief speaker.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest of Jupiter, who was before their city, brought bulls and garlands unto the gates and would have done sacrifice unto them with the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of it, they rent their clothes and ran in among the people, crying out
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all the things that are therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: who in generations past suffered all the Gentiles to walk in their own ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless he did not leave himself without witness, in that he did good and gave us rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with these words they scarcely restrained the people, that they not sacrifice unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew him out of the city, supposing he was dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up and came into the city, and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra and to Iconium and Antioch,
speaker: Narrator

text: confirming the souls of the disciples and exhorting them to remain in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having ordained elders for them in every congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} and having prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord on whom they believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia
speaker: Narrator

text: and from there sailed to Antioch, where they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they were come and had gathered the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} together, they related what great things God had done with them and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there they abode a long time with the disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then certain men who came down from Judaea taught the brethren and said, Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas and certain other of them should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, being accompanied by some from the congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles, and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received by the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} and by the apostles and elders, and they declared all the things that God had done with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees who had believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them and to command them to keep the law of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the apostles and elders came together to consider of this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up and said unto them, Men and brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God chose that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel and believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God, who knows the hearts, bore them witness, giving them the Holy Spirit, even as he did unto us,
speaker: Narrator

text: and put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God, putting a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: For we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the multitude kept silence and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what great miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after they had become silent, James answered, saying, Men and brethren, hearken unto me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simeon has declared how God first visited the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,
speaker: Narrator

text: After this I will return and will restore the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will repair its ruins, and I will set it up again,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the men that are left might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who does all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my sentence is that those from among the Gentiles who are converted to God not be troubled,
speaker: Narrator

text: but that we write unto them that they abstain from pollutions of idols and from fornication and from things strangled and from blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses of old time has in every city those that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it pleased the apostles and elders, with the whole congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; namely, Judas surnamed Barsabas and Silas, principal men among the brethren;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they wrote letters by them after this manner: The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren who are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia;
speaker: Narrator

text: forasmuch as we have heard that certain ones who went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, Ye must be circumcised and keep the law, to whom we gave no such commandment,
speaker: Narrator

text: it seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
speaker: Narrator

text: men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell you the same things by mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things:
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye abstain from foods offered to idols and from blood and from things strangled and from fornication; from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch; and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle,
speaker: Narrator

text: which when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words and confirmed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after they had tarried there a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching the word of the Lord and announcing the gospel, with many others also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some days after, Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord and see how they do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul thought it not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia and did not go with them to the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the contention was so sharp between them that they departed asunder one from the other, and so Barnabas took Mark and sailed unto Cyprus;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Paul chose Silas and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the congregations. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he came to Derbe and Lystra; and, behold, a certain disciple was there named Timothy, the son of a Jewish woman, who was faithful, but his father was a Gentile,
speaker: Narrator

text: of whom the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium gave good witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul desired to have him go forth with him and took and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those quarters, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they went through the cities, they asked them to keep the decrees that had been determined by the apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} were established in the faith and increased in number daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now passing through Phrygia and the region of Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to preach the word in Asia;
speaker: Narrator

text: after they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit suffered them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a vision was shown to Paul in the night: There stood a man of Macedonia, asking him, saying, Come over into Macedonia and help us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us to preach the gospel unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the next day to Neapolis,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from there to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia, and a colony; and we were in that city abiding certain days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on one of the sabbaths we went out of the city by a river side, where it was customary to pray; and we sat down and spoke unto the women who gathered there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, who feared God, heard us, whose heart the Lord opened that she attended unto the things which were spoken by Paul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she was baptized, with her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house and abide there. And she constrained us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a Pythian spirit met us, which brought her masters much gain by divination:
speaker: Narrator

text: she followed Paul and us and cried out, saying, These men are the slaves of the most high God, who announce unto us the way of deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she did this for many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers
speaker: Narrator

text: and brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city
speaker: Narrator

text: and teach rites which are not lawful for us to receive neither to observe, being Romans.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the multitude rose up together against them, and the magistrates rent off their clothes and commanded to beat them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely,
speaker: Narrator

text: who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison and made their feet fast in the stocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: But at midnight as Paul and Silas prayed and sang praises unto God, and the prisoners heard them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one’s bands were loosed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the keeper of the prison, awaking out of his sleep and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm, for we are all here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called for a light and came inside and fell down trembling before Paul and Silas
speaker: Narrator

text: and brought them out and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they spoke unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their stripes and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had brought them into his house, he set food before them and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the sergeants, saying, Let those men go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the keeper of the prison made these words known unto Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go; now therefore depart and go in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us out in secret? no indeed; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sergeants returned and told these words unto the magistrates; and they feared when they heard that they were Romans.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came and besought them, and bringing them out, asked them to depart out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And leaving the prison, they entered into the house of Lydia; and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them and departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where the synagogue of the Jews was.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,
speaker: Narrator

text: declaring openly and proposing that it behooved the Christ to have suffered and risen again from the dead and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of them believed and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the noble women not a few.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the disobedient Jews, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort and gathered a company and set all the city on an uproar and assaulted the house of Jason and sought to bring them out to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they did not find them, they brought Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down have come here also,
speaker: Narrator

text: whom Jason has received, and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city when they heard these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had taken security of Jason and of the others, they let them go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the brethren immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night unto Berea, who when they got there went into the synagogue of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all diligence and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore many of them believed, also of honourable women who were Greeks and of men, not a few.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached by Paul at Berea, they came there also and stirred up the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then immediately the brethren sent Paul to go away towards the sea, but Silas and Timothy abode there still.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens; and receiving an order from him unto Silas and Timothy to come unto him as soon as possible, they departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him when he saw the city completely given over to idolatry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he disputed in the synagogue with the Jews and with the devout persons and in the market daily with those that he met with.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans and of the Stoics encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? others, He seems to be a setter forth of new gods, because he preached unto them Jesus and the resurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took him and brought him unto the Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine is, of which thou speakest?
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou bringest certain new things to our ears; we desire, therefore, to know what these things mean.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For all the Athenians and strangers who were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of the Areopagus, {Mars’ Hill} and said, Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as I passed by and beheld your sanctuaries, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him I declare unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God that made the world and all the things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, does not dwell in temples made with hands;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he gives to all life and breath and all things
speaker: Narrator

text: and has made of one blood all the lineage of men to dwell on all the face of the earth and has determined the seasons (which he has limited) and the bounds of their habitation;
speaker: Narrator

text: that they should seek the Lord, if in any manner they might reach out to touch him and find him though he is not far from each one of us;
speaker: Narrator

text: for in him we live and move and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also of his lineage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Being therefore of the lineage of God, we ought not to think that which is Divine is like unto gold or silver or stone, bearing the mark of art and man’s imagination.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the times of this ignorance God overlooked, but he now commands all men everywhere to repent
speaker: Narrator

text: because he has appointed a day, in which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he has ordained; of whom he has given assurance unto all men in that he has raised him from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked; and others said, We will hear thee again of this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Paul departed from among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But certain men believed and joined themselves with him, among whom was Dionysius of the Areopagus and a woman named Damaris and others with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens and came to Corinth
speaker: Narrator

text: and found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla (for Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome) and came unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them and worked, for by their occupation they were tentmakers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath and persuaded Jews and Greeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Silas and Timothy were come from Macedonia, Paul was impressed by the Spirit and testified to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they opposed themselves and blasphemed, he shook his raiment and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean; from now on I will go unto the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he departed from there and entered into a certain man’s house, named Titus the Just, one that feared God, whose house was next to the synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians, hearing, believed and were baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Paul in the night by a vision, Do not be afraid, but speak and do not be silent,
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am with thee, and no one shall be able to hurt thee, for I have many people in this city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he continued there a year and six months, teaching them the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Gallio was the proconsul of Achaia, the Jews rose up with one accord against Paul and brought him to the judgment seat,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, This fellow persuades men to honor God contrary to the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O ye Jews, reason would that I should bear with you;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if it is a question of words and names and of your law, look ye to it, for I will be no judge of such matters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he drove them from the judgment seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while and then took his leave of the brethren and sailed from there into Syria and with him Priscilla and Aquila, having shorn his head in Cenchrea, for he had a vow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came to Ephesus and left them there, but he himself entered into the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them, he consented not,
speaker: Narrator

text: but bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that comes in Jerusalem, but I will return again unto you, if God wills. And he sailed from Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea and gone up to Jerusalem and after greeting the congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} he went down to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after he had spent some time there, he departed and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, confirming all the disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man and mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spoke and taught diligently the things of the Lord, teaching only in the baptism of John.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue, but when Aquila and Priscilla had heard him, they took him unto them and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the exhorted brethren wrote the disciples to receive him, who, when he was come, was very helpful through grace unto those who had believed;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he mightily convinced the Jews in public, showing by the scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul, having passed through the upper coasts, came to Ephesus, and finding certain disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: he said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Spirit since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there is any Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Into what then were ye baptized? And they said, Into John’s baptism.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people that they should believe on him who should come after him, that is, on Christ, Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard this, they were baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke in tongues and prophesied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the men were about twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went into the synagogue and spoke freely for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when some were hardened and disobedient, but cursing the way before the multitude, he departed from them and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this continued by the space of two years so that all those who dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul
speaker: Narrator

text: so that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon themselves to invoke over those who had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew and prince of the priests, who did so.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I am acquainted with, but who are ye?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them and overcame them and prevailed against them so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many that believed came, confessing and declaring their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner many who had practiced vain arts brought their books together and burned them before everyone, and they counted the price of them and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the word of God grew mightily and prevailed.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things were ended, Paul purposed by the Spirit to go to Jerusalem, after he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, saying, After I have been there, it behooves me to see Rome also.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of those that ministered unto him, Timothy and Erastus, but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith who made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen,
speaker: Narrator

text: whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation and said, Sirs, ye know that by this gain we have our wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people, saying that they are not gods which are made with hands
speaker: Narrator

text: so that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought, but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they heard these sayings, they were full of wrath and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion, and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain of the chief persons of Asia, who were his friends, sent unto him, asking him that he not present himself in the theatre.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another, for the assembly was confused; and most of them did not know why they were come together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand and would have made his defense unto the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the town scribe, appeasing the people, said, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there that does not know how the city of the Ephesians is honored of the great goddess Diana and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be gainsaid, ye ought to be quiet and to do nothing rashly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye have brought here these men, who are neither guilty of sacrilege, nor blasphemers of your goddess.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are proconsuls; let them accuse one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are in danger of being accused of sedition for this day’s uproar, there being no cause by which we may give an account of this concourse.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called the disciples and embraced them and departed to go into Macedonia.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had gone over those parts and had exhorted them with much word, he came into Greece
speaker: Narrator

text: and there abode three months. And when the Jews laid in wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he took counsel to return through Macedonia.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe and Timothy; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.
speaker: Narrator

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread and came unto them to Troas in five days, where we abode seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the first of the sabbaths, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart the next day, and continued his word until midnight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were many lamps in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain young man named Eutychus sat in a window, being fallen into a deep sleep; and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep and fell down from the third loft and was taken up dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Paul went down and fell on him and, embracing him, said, Trouble not yourselves, for his soul is still in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he therefore was come up again and had broken bread and eaten and talked a long while, even until day break, thus he departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we went into the ship and sailed unto Assos, intending to take in Paul there, for so he had determined that he should go by land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in and came to Mitylene.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we sailed from there and came the next day over against Chios, and the next day we arrived in port at Samos; and having rested in Trogyllium, the next day we came to Miletus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, not to detain himself in Asia, for he hasted to keep the day of Pentecost, if it were possible for him, in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus and called the elders of the congregation. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,
speaker: Narrator

text: serving the Lord with all humility and with many tears and temptations, which have befallen me by the ambushes of the Jews,
speaker: Narrator

text: and how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you, but have showed you and have taught you publicly and from house to house,
speaker: Narrator

text: testifying both to the Jews and also to the Gentiles, repentance toward God and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, I go bound of the Spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there,
speaker: Narrator

text: except that the Holy Spirit witnesses in every city, saying that prisons and tribulations await me.
speaker: Narrator
